body:
### Problem

Using master I get a very similar bug to https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32068, in which `vim.fn.input`'s multi-line prompt is cleared with `nvim__redraw`.

### Steps to reproduce

```
nvim --clean -u cmdlineenter_color.lua
```

The startup file `cmdlineenter_color.lua` creates autocmds that change the statusline foreground color when entering and leaving Cmdline-mode (calling `nvim__redraw` is necessary so that the color actually changes in Cmdline-mode). Source `input_multi_line.lua`, which invokes `vim.fn.input` with a multi-line prompt (`:so input_multi_line.lua`).

<details>
  <summary>cmdlineenter_color.lua</summary>

```lua
local function set_foreground(color)
  local statusline = vim.api.nvim_get_hl(0, { name = "StatusLine" })
  vim.api.nvim_set_hl(0, "StatusLine", { bold = true, bg = statusline.bg, fg = color })
end

local function set_foreground_to_blue()
  set_foreground("#0000ff")
end


local cmdline_color = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup("cmdline_color", { clear = true })

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("CmdlineEnter", {
  pattern = { ":", "/", "?" },
  group = cmdline_color,
  desc = "Changes statusline foreground color to GREEN when in Cmdline mode",
  callback = function()
    set_foreground("#00ff00")

    vim.api.nvim__redraw({ flush = true })
  end,
})

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("ModeChanged", {
  pattern = "[^n]*:n*",
  group = cmdline_color,
  desc = "Changes statusline foreground color to BLUE when in Normal mode",
  callback = function()
    set_foreground_to_blue()
  end,
})

set_foreground_to_blue()
```
</details>

<details>
  <summary>input_multi_line.lua</summary>

```lua
local items = {
  "Apple",
  "Banana",
  "Melon",
  "Pear",
  "Watermelon",
}

local choices = {}

for i, item in pairs(items) do
  local choice = string.format("%d. %s", i, item)
  table.insert(choices, choice)
end

local answer = vim.fn.input(
  string.format("\n%s\n%s: ", table.concat(choices, "\n"), "Pick a fruit")
)

print("\n\nPicked " .. answer .. ".")
```
</details>

### Expected behavior

Prompt is not cleared.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-566+gbac133e4b6

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

Don't know

### Operating system/version

Linux WSL2 Ubuntu 24.04

### Terminal name/version

WezTerm 20250320-072107-a8735851

### $TERM environment variable

wezterm

### Installation

Downloaded from Neovim Github releases
